column5: https://globalnews.ca/news/3806747/actor-john-dunsworth-has-died-at-the-age-of-71/ I thought this guy played his part perfectly, always made me laugh, a lot! The Park isn't going to be the same with his passing. I hope his family finds peace... HH
The blue liquor episode where he fills up a swimming pool and ends up looking like a Smurf was epic!  RIP Mr leahey
My fav was when him and Randy came out.  Randy dressed in the bee outfit and Lahey as Indiana Jones (Or as Ricky would say Indianapolis Jones, lol!)
The blue liquor episode where he fills up a swimming pool and ends up looking like a Smurf was epic!  RIP Mr leahey I had tears rolling down my face.... HH

Funny story... about 4 years ago my son was going to Brock University and was walking along with a couple buddies when a car pulled up. One of the guys inside leaned out and asked "Any of you sh!tweasels know where Issac's bar is?" It was Randy and Lahey on campus for a publicity gig and in perfect form!

Epic! I would have died laughing. I seen them in grande prairie for a comedy show and my gawd it was hilarious! Randy and leahey weren't in the show but I met them backstage. Very funny guys, to the point I wasn't sure if it was an act or they were really like that lol

That's amazing!! Hahaha. John dunsworth was also amazing at improv, one second you'd believe he showed up to the show absolutely liquored and all of a sudden he'd change character and he'd be sober as a rock, whether he was still at that point or not it was really unclear because of how convincing he was in his acting. I saw him at Mohawk college once and somewb else a second time a while ago, great guy

For a million bucks I wouldn't recognize his name and that is regretfully sad when it comes to Canadian talent. Say Mr. Lehey, of course, everyone know him. Condolences to his fans, friends, and family.

That's amazing!! Hahaha. John dunsworth was also amazing at improv, one second you'd believe he showed up to the show absolutely liquored and all of a sudden he'd change character and he'd be sober as a rock, whether he was still at that point or not it was really unclear because of how convincing he was in his acting. I saw him at Mohawk college once and somewb else a second time a while ago, great guy   Apparently, he never drank. So I just heard .

Apparently, he never drank. So I just heard .  he didnt drink...hes is by far the best drunk actor of all time without any question...the episode the cheeseburger picnic where he pretends to get smashed in order to catch the guys in a scheme shows his ability to switch on a dime.   my favourite moment of all time
